resources.string: Starting from Android M (6.0), the system requires apps to be granted \nlocation access in order to scan for BLE devices.

The application needs All Files Storage Permission 
to store and manage the devices' information 

Please allow All files access for Jhpiego App
Ble scan failed with error code :
Please enter a name for the device to setup the device
Device already setup! Please check the Dashboard
The blood pressure monitor is abnormal, please contact the dealer.
blood pressure monitor is connecting, please wait......
blood pressure monitor is disconected, will be scaning again
The bloodpressure monitor is not available.
The user name can not be empty！
bluetooth is scaning, please make sure your device is turning on/ restart device......
Please sit down and keep quiet
Current mobile phone scanning Bluetooth needs to open the positioning function

Locating the heartbeat:

 Generally, the fetal heart is located 10cm below the lower abdomen, positioned centrally.


 • FHR is usually not clearly heard in the first 12 weeks.

 • In case the heartbeat is not heard, nothing to worry about.

 • Limit one session to less than 5 minutes.

Locating the heartbeat:

 Generally, the fetal heart is located 10cm below the umbilicus, positioned centrally.


 • Most people are unable to hear a clear heartbeat before 12 weeks, in case you don’t hear a heartbeat don’t worry.

 • Don’t use the device very frequently (more than once a day).

 • Limit one session to less than 5 minutes.

Locating the heartbeat:

 Start from the lower abdomen, and move the probe up (centrally). If the heartbeat is not heard, gradually move the probe to the sides (left/right one after the other). Do not go above the umbilicus.


 • In case you don’t find a heartbeat, there is nothing to worry about. Locating the heartbeat is difficult before the third trimester.

 • Limit one session to less than 5 minutes.

 • Any reading greater than 100 bpm is the baby’s heartbeat and any reading between 70 bpm to 90 bpm is the mother’s..

Locating the heartbeat:

 Start from the lower abdomen, slowly glide the probe from the extreme right to extreme left. Keep moving upwards as long as the heartbeat is not found. The heartbeat may be found higher than the umbilicus.


 • Any heartbeat above 100 bpm is the baby’s. Anything between 70 to 90 bpm might be the mother’s.

 • In case a heartbeat is not found try again after sometime.
Pair your FHR Monitor to your phone via bluetooth by clicking on connect
Follow instructions on the next screen to locate your baby\'s heartbeat
To reconnect, Please switch off the FHR device
We are looking into the problem
For now, please enter the FHR reading manually!
